question: What time do you open and close?
answer: Mon-Fri 8 AM-6 PM, Sat 8 AM-1 PM, closed Sundays & major holidays.

question: Can I just walk in or do I need an appointment?
answer: Both! Walk-ins welcome, but booking an appointment guarantees shorter wait.

question: How do I make an appointment?
answer: Online (website/app), patient portal, or call us at (555) 123-4567.

question: Can I book online right now?
answer: Yes, 24/7 booking is open on our website and app.

question: Do you have same-day appointments?
answer: Yes, we keep slots open every day for urgent/same-day needs.

question: How long is the wait if I walk in?
answer: Usually 15-45 minutes depending on how busy we are.

question: Do you accept my insurance?
answer: We take most major plans — tell us your insurance and we'll verify instantly.

question: I don't have insurance, how much is a visit?
answer: Self-pay visits are $90-$150 depending on the type of visit.

question: Do you see kids/babies?
answer: Yes! We treat newborns to seniors.

question: Do you have a pediatrician today?
answer: Yes, pediatricians are in Mon-Sat.

question: Can I get a school/sports physical today?
answer: Yes, usually same-day or next-day.

question: Do you do immigration medical exams?
answer: Yes, our civil surgeons perform USCIS I-693 exams.

question: I need a work note / sick note, can the doctor write one?
answer: Yes, just ask the doctor during your visit.

question: Can I get a COVID/flu shot without an appointment?
answer: Yes, walk-in shots available during business hours.

question: Do you do COVID testing?
answer: Yes — rapid antigen (15 min) and PCR (1-2 days).

question: Do you do blood work here?
answer: Yes, in-house lab with most results same or next day.

question: How long until I get my lab results?
answer: Routine labs: 1-3 business days. Many tests same-day.

question: Can I see my results online?
answer: Yes, they appear in your patient portal as soon as ready.

question: Do you refill prescriptions?
answer: Yes, existing patients can request via portal or phone.

question: My pharmacy needs prior authorization — can you do it today?
answer: Yes, we usually complete same day.

question: Do you offer telehealth/video visits?
answer: Yes, for follow-ups, rashes, colds, mental health, meds, etc.

question: Is there parking?
answer: Free parking in front and behind the building.

question: Is the clinic wheelchair accessible?
answer: Yes — ramp, wide doors, accessible rooms.

question: Can I bring someone with me?
answer: Yes, one companion is fine. Parent required for minors.

question: Do you have Spanish-speaking doctors?
answer: Yes + free interpreters for all other languages.

question: I'm running late — will you still see me?
answer: Up to 15 min late is okay; call if later.

question: What's your cancellation policy?
answer: 24-hour notice or $35 fee may apply.

question: Can I change my appointment time?
answer: Yes, online or by phone.

question: Do you treat anxiety and depression?
answer: Yes, mild-moderate cases (refer to psychiatry when needed).

question: Do you do Pap smears and birth control?
answer: Yes, full women's health services.

question: I think I have a UTI — can I come in today?
answer: Yes, same-day UTI visits available.

question: Do you remove moles or skin tags?
answer: Yes, minor procedures done in office.

question: Do you treat acne?
answer: Yes — creams, oral meds, Accutane when needed.

question: Can I get travel vaccines here?
answer: Yes — yellow fever, typhoid, hepatitis, etc.

question: Do you do allergy testing and shots?
answer: Yes, skin testing + immunotherapy.

question: My child has an ear infection — can you see him today?
answer: Yes, we prioritize same-day sick child visits.

question: Do you do stitches for cuts?
answer: Yes, laceration repair on site.

question: I sprained my ankle — do you do X-rays?
answer: Yes, digital X-ray on site.

question: Do you treat asthma?
answer: Yes, full management + breathing tests.

question: I need a DOT/CDL physical — how much?
answer: $120, about 30 minutes.

question: Are your doctors board-certified?
answer: Yes, all are board-certified or board-eligible.

question: Can I choose which doctor I see?
answer: Yes, request any provider when booking.

question: Do you offer weight loss programs?
answer: Yes, medical weight management + GLP-1 meds if appropriate.

question: Is there a pharmacy inside?
answer: No, but three pharmacies within 2-min walk.

question: Can I pay with Apple Pay?
answer: Yes — cards, Apple/Google Pay, HSA/FSA.

question: Do you have a patient portal?
answer: Yes, sign up online or at first visit.

question: How do I get my medical records?
answer: Free electronic copy via portal or front desk.

question: I lost my insurance card — what now?
answer: We can look it up or you can self-pay & get reimbursed.

question: Do you see patients without insurance?
answer: Yes, discounted self-pay rates available.

question: Is the waiting room kid-friendly?
answer: Yes — toys, books, TV for kids.

question: Do you do pre-op physicals?
answer: Yes, usually same or next-day.

question: Can I get a TB test for work/school?
answer: Yes, PPD placement and reading.

question: Do you treat erectile dysfunction (ED)?
answer: Yes, confidential and effective treatment.

question: My baby has a rash — how soon can we be seen?
answer: Same-day pediatric sick visits almost always available.

question: Do you do ear wax removal?
answer: Yes, irrigation or manual.

question: I have pink eye — can I come in?
answer: Yes, seen daily.

question: Do you offer PRP or joint injections?
answer: Yes for appropriate conditions.

question: Can I get the shingles vaccine?
answer: Yes, Shingrix (2-dose).

question: Do you do employment drug testing?
answer: Yes, urine drug screens on site.

question: I need a specialist referral — can you do it?
answer: Yes, electronic referral same day.

question: Are you open Saturday?
answer: Yes, until 1 PM.

question: Do you close for lunch?
answer: No, open straight through.

question: Can I get a second opinion?
answer: Absolutely welcome.

question: Do you treat migraines?
answer: Yes, acute and preventive options.

question: Do you do rapid strep tests?
answer: Yes, results in 5-10 minutes.

question: Do you give IV fluids for dehydration?
answer: Yes, in-office IV hydration available.

question: Can my teenager come alone?
answer: 16+ can come alone with consent.

question: Do you have a dietician?
answer: Yes, appointments available.

question: I'm pregnant — do you do prenatal care?
answer: Early prenatal care yes; delivery referred to OB.

question: Do you test for STDs?
answer: Yes, confidential testing & treatment.

question: Can I get HPV vaccine (Gardasil)?
answer: Yes, ages 9-45.

question: Do you treat thyroid problems?
answer: Yes, full evaluation and management.

question: I have high cholesterol — can you help?
answer: Yes, lifestyle + meds if needed.

question: Do you do EKGs?
answer: Yes, in-office with immediate reading.

question: Can I get birth control pills today?
answer: Yes, same-day prescriptions.

question: Do you insert/remove IUDs or Nexplanon?
answer: Yes, often same-day.

question: Can I get a jury duty medical excuse?
answer: Yes if medically appropriate.

question: Do you offer cash discounts?
answer: Yes, lower self-pay rates for prompt payment.

question: How early should I arrive for first visit?
answer: 15 minutes to complete paperwork.

question: Can I fill forms online before coming?
answer: Yes, link sent when you book.

question: Is there Wi-Fi?
answer: Yes, free guest Wi-Fi.

question: Do I need to fast before blood work?
answer: Only if test says “fasting required.”

question: Can I bring my service animal?
answer: Yes, always welcome.

question: Do you validate parking?
answer: Parking is free — no validation needed.

question: What if I have an emergency after hours?
answer: Call main number for on-call doctor or go to ER.

question: Do you have a nurse advice line?
answer: Yes, call anytime — after-hours to on-call team.

question: Can I message the doctor?
answer: Yes via portal, answered in 1-2 business days.

question: Do you treat sleep apnea?
answer: We diagnose/manage; sleep studies referred.

question: I have fever & cough — should I come in?
answer: Yes, we have separate sick waiting area.

question: Do you do minor surgery (cyst removal, etc.)?
answer: Yes, many done in office.

question: Can I get meningitis vaccine for college?
answer: Yes, MenACWY & MenB available.

question: Do you offer Botox?
answer: Medical Botox yes; cosmetic at select locations.

question: I'm traveling — motion sickness meds?
answer: Yes, Rx and OTC options.

question: Do you treat hair loss?
answer: Yes — labs + minoxidil, finasteride, PRP.

question: Can I get a tetanus shot?
answer: Yes, Td/Tdap anytime.

question: Who do I call about a billing question?
I moved — how to update address?
answer: Tell front desk or update in portal.

question: Do you offer group classes (diabetes, prenatal, etc.)?
answer: Yes, schedule on our website.

question: I'm not getting reminder texts — why?
answer: Check your cell number in the portal or call us.

question: Do you do annual wellness visits or physicals?
answer: Yes, comprehensive physicals & preventive care.
